questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The trajectory of projectile, projected from the ground is given by y = x - x²/20. Where x and y are measured in meter. The maximum height attained by the projectile will be.

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The acceleration due to gravity at height h above the earth if h << R (Radius of earth) is given by
questions.concept: Acceleration due to gravity at height

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Electric potential at a point 'P' due to a point charge of 5 × 10⁻⁹C is 50 V. The distance of 'P' from the point charge is: (Assume, 1/4πε₀ = 9 × 10⁹ Nm²C⁻²)

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: An emf of 0.08 V is induced in a metal rod of length 10 cm held normal to a uniform magnetic field of 0.4 T, when moves with a velocity of :

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText:
Given below are two statement: one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R.
Assertion A: Electromagnets are made of soft iron.
Reason R: Soft iron has high permeability and low retentivity.
In the light of above, statement, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below.

options.text: A is not correct but R is correct
A is correct but R is not correct
Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A hydraulic automobile lift is designed to vehicles of mass 5000 kg. The area of cross section of the cylinder carrying the load is 250 cm². The maximum pressure the smaller piston would have to bear is [Assume g = 10 m/s²]

questions.questionText: The equivalent resistance between A and B as shown in figure is:

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText:
In photo electric effect
(A) The photocurrent is proportional to the intensity of the incident radiation.
(B) Maximum kinetic energy with which photoelectrons are emitted depends on the intensity of incident light.
(C) Max. K.E with which photoelectron are emitted depends on the frequency of incident light.
(D) The emission of photoelectron require a minimum threshold intensity of incident radiation.
(E) Max K.E of the photoelectrons is independent of the frequency of the incident light.
Choose the correct answer from the options given below:

questions.questionText: The temperature at which the kinetic energy of oxygen molecules becomes double than its value at 27°C is

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Work done by carnot engine operating between temperatures 127°C and 27°C is 2kJ. The amount of heat transferred to the engine by the reservoir is:

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The width of fringe is 2 mm on the screen in a double slits experiment for the light of wavelength of 400 nm. The width of the fringe for the light of wavelength 600 nm will be:

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: For a given transistor amplifier circuit in CE configuration VCC = 1 V, RC = 1 kΩ, Rb = 100 kΩ and β = 100. Value of base current Ib is

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: For particle P revolving round the centre O with radius of circular path r and angular velocity ω, as shown in below figure. the projection of OP on the x-axis at time t is
questions.concept: Projection of circular motion on axis

questions.questionText: The waves emitted when a metal target is bombarded with high energy electrons are

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText:
Given below are two statements:
Statement I : Area under velocity-time graph given the distance travelled by the body in a given time
Statement II : Area under acceleration-time graph is equal to the change in velocity in the given time.
In the light of given statement, choose the correct answer from the options given below:

options.text: Both Statement I and Statement II are False
Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is true.
Statement I is correct but Statement II is False.
Both Statement I and Statement II are true.

questions.concept: Area under velocity-time and acceleration-time graphs

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A radio active material is reduced to 1/8 of its original amount in 3 days. If 8 × 10⁻³ kg of the material is left after 5 days the initial amount of the material is

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The orbital angular momentum of a satellite is L, when it is revolving in a circular orbit at height h from earth surface. If the distance of satellite from the earth centre is increased by eight times to its initial value, then the new angular momentum will be-

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A bullet of mass 0.1 kg moving horizontally with speed 400 ms⁻¹ hits a wooden block of mass 3.9 kg kept on a horizontal rough surface. The bullet gets embedded into the block and moves 20 m before coming to rest. The coefficient of friction between the block and the surface is (Given g = 10 m/s²)

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The power radiated from a linear antenna of length ℓ is proportional to (Given, λ = Wavelength of wave):

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText:
Match List-I with List-II
LIST-I       LIST-II
(A) Torque     (I) ML⁻²T⁻²
(B) Stress      (II) ML²T⁻²
(C) Pressure gradient  (III) ML⁻¹T⁻¹
(D) Coefficient of viscosity    (IV) ML⁻¹T⁻²
Choose the correct answer from the options given below:

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A series combination of resistor of resistance 100 Ω, inductor of inductance 1 H and capacitor of capacitance 6.25 μF is connected to an ac source. The quality factor of the circuit will be______.

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A body of mass 5 kg is moving with a momentum of 10 kg ms⁻¹. Now a force of 2 N acts on the body in the direction of its motion for 5 s. The increase in the Kinetic energy of the body is________ J.

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Two transparent media having refractive indices 1.0 and 1.5 are separated by a spherical refracting surface of radius of curvature 30 cm. The centre of curvature of surface is towards denser medium and a point object is placed on the principle axis in rarer medium at a distance of 15 cm from the pole of the surface. The distance of image from the pole of the surface is__________cm.
questions.concept: Image formation by spherical refracting surface

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A steel rod of length 1 m and cross sectional area 10⁻⁴ m² is heated from 0°C to 200°C without being allowed to extend or bend. The compressive tension produced in the rod is_______ x10⁴ N. (Given Young's modulus of steel = 2×10¹¹ Nm⁻², coefficient of linear expansion = 10⁻⁵K⁻¹)

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The ratio of wavelength of spectral lines Hα and Hβ in the Balmer series is x/20. The value of x is_____.

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The number density of free electrons in copper is nearly 8 x 10²⁸ m⁻³. A copper wire has its area of cross section = 2 × 10⁻⁶ m² and is carrying a current of 3.2 A. The drift speed of the electrons is______×10⁻⁶

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The ratio of magnetic field at the centre of a current carrying coil of radius r to the magnetic field at distance r from the centre of coil on its axis is √x:1. The value of x is________.
questions.concept: Magnetic field due to circular coil

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A guitar string of length 90 cm vibrates with a fundamental frequency of 120 Hz. The length of the string producing a fundamental frequency of 180 Hz will be ____ cm.

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A 600 pF capacitor is charged by 200 V supply. It is then disconnected from the supply and is connected to another uncharged 600 pF capacitor. Electrostatic energy lost in the process is_______μJ.

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A hollow spherical ball of uniform density rolls up a curved surface with an initial velocity 3 m/s (as shown in figure). Maximum height with respect to the initial position covered by it will be__________cm (take, g = 10 m/s²)
